alert.note: Alert for Niihau in Kauai (Hawaii) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 18 at 6:29AM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 930 AM HST THIS MORNING FOR THE ISLAND OF KAUAI IN KAUAI COUNTY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...The island of Kauai in Kauai County. * WHEN...Until 930 AM HST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding on roads, poor drainage areas, and in streams. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 619 AM HST, radar indicated widespread moderate to locally heavy rain over Kauai. Rain was falling at a rate of 1 to 2 inches per hour. Additional heavy showers will be moving in from the southwest over the next few hours. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... the entire island of Kauai, with rainfall especially heavy along south and west facing slopes and coasts. This advisory may need to be extended beyond 930 AM HST if flooding persists.
info.instruction: Stay away from streams, drainage ditches and low lying areas prone to flooding. Do not cross fast flowing or rising water in your vehicle, or on foot. Turn around, don`t drown. A Flood Watch is also in effect for all Hawaiian Islands through Monday night.
